ARABIC: وَإِنْ أَدْرِى لَعَلَّهُۥ فِتْنَةٌ لَّكُمْ وَمَتَٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: For all I know it might be a trial for you and you will have enjoyment for a time.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I do not know if this be a trial for you, or a little advantage for a while."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: I think that this [reprieve] is possibly a trial for you, an opportunity to enjoy yourselves until an appointed time."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I do not know (why God has commanded me to warn you of the torment). Perhaps it is a trial for you and a respite for an appointed time".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And what do I know – it may be a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a time.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And I know not, perhaps it may be a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a while."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And I do not know if this may be a trial for you and a provision till a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: I know not; haply it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and enjoyment for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Nor do I know whether it may mean a trial for you and a short reprieve."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And know not; haply it may be a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a season.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: I do not know—maybe it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a while.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: I know not but that it may be a trial for you, and a grant of (worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And I know not, perhaps it may be a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a while.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And I do not know if this is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “And I do not know whether it is perhaps a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a while.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:111] I do not know; perhaps that, which I have notified you of, but whose time is not known, may be a trial, a test, for you, to see how you will act, and an enjoyment for a while, that is, until your terms of life are concluded (this [second] clause [wa-matā‘un, ‘and an enjoyment’] counters the former, which is the object of the optative expressed by [the particle] la‘alla, ‘perhaps’; the second [clause] cannot be an optative).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And I know not but that this) postponement of chastisement (may be a trial for you) may be a test for you, (and enjoyment for a while) until the chastisement visits you.
